Info.Description: Generates a type of noise called Perlin noise, a smooth, natural-looking form of gradient noise. Perlin noise is a staple in computer graphics used for creating realistic textures and visual effects like fire, water, and clouds.

Properties.Name: Scale
Properties.Summary: Adjusts the size of the noise pattern. A larger scale increases the size of the features in the noise, creating fewer but larger areas of color. A smaller scale decreases the feature size, resulting in a more detailed noise pattern with more, smaller areas of color.

Properties.Name: Gradient
Properties.Summary: Selects the colors that will be used in the Perlin noise. The gradient is interpolated over the grayscale noise values. Each point in the noise pattern is assigned a color from the gradient based on its value, with low values taking colors from one end of the gradient and high values from the other end.
